required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Healthy Lifetime - Sustainability and Quality Study
clinical_study.official_title: Healthy Lifetime - Sustainability and Quality Study

brief_summary.textblock: HealthyLifetime (HL) is a person-centered program that enables older adults to maximize health and optimize functioning - the necessary requisite to successfully remaining independent in their preferred home setting as long as possible, i.e., to age in place.

detailed_description.textblock: HL seeks to intervene early in the aging process when individuals have the best chance for longer term benefits of changing their health behavior, as a means to stave off functional decline, and minimize the onset or exacerbation of chronic conditions. And, for individuals who are experiencing any of the barriers described above, our HL program's Nurse Coaches are prepared and experienced in helping them achieve their highest level of functioning and self-care capacity, while integrating and collaborating with, but not duplicating, their medical services such as primary care, specialty care, and case management or medical social services. While the latter medically oriented services support clinical management, they do not focus on helping older adults maximize health and function by building self-care capacity, long term health behavior change capacity and the functional resilience necessary to sustain or regain independent living.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Participant Self- rated health score
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Participants perception of their health on a scale of 1= Excellent to 5 = Poor

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Self-efficacy in ability to continue essential life activities score
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Confidence of the participant in doing certain activities on a scale of 1= Not at all confident to 10 = Totally Confident. For the purposes of answering these questions, confidence is defined as the belief in the participant's chances of being able to do and/or complete an activity (e.g., hobbies and recreation, social visits, chores, errands, etc.) or task (e.g., hobbies and recreation, social visits, chores, errands, etc.) successfully however the participant defines it.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Independent self care agency score
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Confidence in doing certain activities, e.g., stick to behavior changes, meet goals, and improve health, on a scale of 1= Not at all confident to 10 = Totally Confident

primary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Activities that participants engage in that affect health in a negative or positive way, e.g., smoking (yes or no), alcohol (number of drinks per week), exercise (0 = none to 4= more than 3 hours/week), food choices (seldom or never to 2 or more times a day)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Health goals of participants (up to 3) and importance of goal (1= Not at all important now to 10 = highest importance now) and confidence in achieving goal (1= Not confident at all to 10 = Completely Confident)

secondary_outcome.measure: Sustained higher values of primary measures at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Are effects of program noted at 8 weeks still present at 16 weeks.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of unplanned medical visits with doctor or primary medical provider in past 3 months (0 = no visits to 8 = 7 or more), emergency room visits (0 = none to 3 = 2 or more), overnight stay in hospital (0 = none to 3 = 2 or more).

other_outcome.measure: Change in Perception of health now and in 3 years score
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
other_outcome.description: Participant thinks health now is and in three years will be 1 = Excellent to 5 = Poor.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Level of Symptomatology score
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
other_outcome.description: Frequency with which participants experience symptoms such as physical discomfort, pain, fatigue, etc. on a scale where 0 = Never to 5 = Always

other_outcome.measure: Change in Confidence in ability to manage symptoms score
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
other_outcome.description: How confident the is participant that they can keep health symptoms/problems from interfering with the things they want to do, e.g., fatigue, physical discomfort, emotional distress, etc. on a scale where 1 = Not at all Confident to 10 = Totally Confident

other_outcome.measure: Change in Level of independence in activities score
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
other_outcome.description: Ability to do daily living activities such as shopping, cooking, managing medications, etc. on a scale where 1 = Not at all Confident to 10 = Totally Confident

other_outcome.measure: Change in Medication taking self care efficacy score
other_outcome.time_frame: At 0, 8 and 16 weeks after study enrollment.
other_outcome.description: Confidence of participants (on a scale where 0 = Not at all Confident to 2 = very Confident) in taking their medications correctly under different conditions, e.g., if take several medication each day, are away from home, if cause side effects, etc.

arm_group.description: This project is designed to prepare and equip the participant for improved self-care capacity, motivational insight, health-related problem solving and decision-making.

intervention.description: This project is an 6-month program providing an initial 2-month intensive evaluation and personalized virtual individual health coaching experience that is designed to prepare and equip the participant for improved self-care capacity, motivational insight, health-related problem solving and decision-making. This intensive period will then be followed by monthly 30-minute Nurse Coach assessment and individual coaching 'check-in' virtual visits, continued use of the electronic platform tools and health tracking system, and access to group 'virtual coaching' on tailored topics of interest to the cohort.

facility.name: University of Michigan School of Nursing
